pulse_schedule.density_control.n_e_green.documentation: Reference waveform. Caution : error bars of the reference/data node are not used in the usual sense, instead they are used to describe the control envelope, with a meaning depending on the chosen envelope_type option.

pulse_schedule.pellet.time.documentation: Timebase for the dynamic nodes located at this level of the IDS structure and below

pulse_schedule.position_control.ovality.documentation: Lower outer squareness of the plasma boundary (definition from T. Luce, Plasma Phys. Control. Fusion 55 (2013) 095009)

pulse_schedule.position_control.ovality..documentation: Reference waveform. Caution : error bars of the reference/data node are not used in the usual sense, instead they are used to describe the control envelope, with a meaning depending on the chosen envelope_type option.

pulse_schedule.position_control.squarene.documentation: Lower inner squareness of the plasma boundary (definition from T. Luce, Plasma Phys. Control. Fusion 55 (2013) 095009)

pulse_schedule.tf.b_field_tor_vacuum.ref.documentation: Vacuum toroidal field at R0 [T]; Positive sign means anti-clockwise when viewing from above. The product R0B0 must be consistent with the b_tor_vacuum_r field of the tf IDS.

pulse_schedule.tf.r0.documentation: Reference major radius where the vacuum toroidal magnetic field is given (usually a fixed position such as the middle of the vessel at the equatorial midplane)
